results.title: Successful sound for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. It also discusses the issues surrounding different types of microphones (handheld, gun, personal), Mono and stereo soundtracks, recording non-sync sound (tape recorders, video camera recorder, commercial sound effects recordings), sound levels and distortion (under- and over-modulation) and mixing sounds using equalisers to control relative volumes, tone and the positioning of sound.

results.title: Melina Mercouri's Athens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
The vivacity of Melina Mercouri - singer, actress and parliamentarian, shines through as she reveals Athens as “a city with ancient ruins but with a heart that beats stronger than ever before”.

results.title: Subversive desires
results.creator_credit: George E. Saxon, George Snow, Julie Kuzminska, Akiko Hada, London Electronic Arts and WKBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video burn”.
A collection of contemporary video music clips which explore some of the avant-garde electronic music and performance coming from Great Britain. As the title for the collection suggests, this volume of “Video Burn” explores themes of sexuality and transgression. All the video artists involved have attempted to trace modern experimentation with sex, fashion and gender in forms which arise from 19th century popular theatre: the circus, gambling, and pantomime. In “The Jack Series”, George E. Saxon uses the myth of Jack the Ripper to examine the decadence of Victorian sexuality and how it still resonates today in sado-masochistic imagery; “Archaos”, by Julie Kuziminska, is a video celebration of the anarchic circus troupe of the same name; and “Assignation” is a video performance of an Edgar Allan Poe short story which brings the story’s sublimated sexuality to the fore.

results.title: Successful lighting for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video emphasises the importance of lighting in successfully portraying the subject of a shot in a video. The areas covered include: contrast; quality; intensity; direction and colour.

results.title: State of the art
results.creator_credit: British Film Institute, Dundee College of the Art, Federation, Middlesex Polytechnic and London Electronic Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Video burn”.
The advent of computer multi-media technology has resulted in a resurgence of the art of animation. This collection of experimental video and music utilises state of the art technology to produce intellectually and visually stimulating pieces which not only celebrate the possibilities of computer generated art, but also pose unsettling questions about the acceleration of technology and information. The videos include: “A New Life” (Simon Biggs) which investigates the link between myths of IVF and myths of the Immaculate Conception; “Torso” (Leigh Cox); “Muybridge Revisited” (Snow); “Sublime NLV6” (Gillman); “Trout Descending a Staircase” (Hawley), which is a very funny and very perverse thumbing of the nose at the capital-A art world; “Double Trouble” (Callas); “Going for Goldfish” (Collins/Myers) which pokes gentle fun at the penis; and John Butler’s damning and electrifying critique of the new global technocratic future, “World Peace Thru Free Trade”, which explores the totalitarian nightmares that might be unleashed by the marriage of capitalism and computer technology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: British Film Institute, Dundee College of the Art, Federation, Middlesex Polytechnic and London Electronic Arts

results.title: Successful editing for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: Editors needs to follow the rules of how people percieve what they are watching - a logical sequence of events - so that the story being told makes sense. Successful editing can enhance the power with which a story can be told by establishing the scene of the story, creating visual interest, following the dramatic focus, controlling timing and emphasis and selecting the best material. This video describes the factors which should be taken into consideration when editing a video sequence.
results.description: Editors needs to follow the rules of how people percieve what they are watching - a logical sequence of events - so that the story being told makes sense. results.title: Successful camerawork for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.
results.description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.

results.title: Subway [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Francois Ruggieri, Gaumont-British Instructional, Les Films du Loup, TFI Films and TSF Production
results.brief_description: This strange combination of action, comedy, violence and suspense tells the story of a cool rebel on the run, who uses the dark tunnels of the Paris subway as his hideout. There he meets a wide assortment of unusual characters. Stars Christopher Lambert and Isabelle Adjani. The soundtrack has been dubbed into English.
